medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe myalgia, arthralgia, and severely limited mobility secondary to pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after 14 days of minocycline therapy with an initial fever, joint swelling, and rash. On the 15th day, he was treated by his primary physician. By the 22nd day, he presented with severe pain and reduced mobility. Symptoms improved within 6 weeks after stopping minocycline, but full recovery of strength and coordination took 3 to 4 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previously treated for Osgood-Schlatter disease; past excision of a cyst as an infant. Otherwise, medical and surgical history is unremarkable.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and epilepsy.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with his mother; father is deceased.
